docs.title: Welcome to dcHook Docs
docs.text: dcHook is a CLI-Application to do a lot with Discord's Webhooks

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Go 1.19+
  • Internet connection

docs.title: 1. Clone the Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/TRC-Loop/dchook.git
cd dchook

docs.title: Linux / macOS
docs.text: go build -o dchook

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
go build -ldflags="-s -w" -o dchook.exe

⚠️ -ldflags="-s -w" helps avoid false-positives from Windows Defender.

docs.title: Linux / macOS
docs.text:
sudo mv dchook /usr/local/bin/

Now run:

dchook --help

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
1. Move dchook.exe to a folder like C:\Tools\

  2. Add that folder to your System PATH:

  3. Start Menu → Search Environment Variables

  4. Click Environment Variables
  5. Edit Path → Add C:\Tools\
  6. Restart PowerShell or Terminal

Then run:

dchook.exe --help

✅ You’re ready to use dchook.

docs.title: Delete Command
docs.text:
Delete a Discord webhook by its URL.

dchook delete --url <webhook-url>

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Flag Shortcut Description Required --url -u Discord webhook URL ✅

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
dchook delete -u https://discord.com/api/webhooks/...

✅ Returns success if the webhook is deleted (204 No Content). ❌ Returns an error if the webhook is invalid or already deleted.

docs.title: Info Command
docs.text:
Fetch and display information about a Discord webhook.

dchook info --url <webhook-url>

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Flag Shortcut Description Required --url -u Discord webhook URL ✅ --raw -r Output raw JSON ❌

docs.title: Output Modes
docs.text:
• Default: Clean, human-readable format
  • --raw: Raw JSON response
  • Fallback: Pretty JSON if decoding fails and --raw is not used

docs.title: Normal output:
docs.text: dchook info -u https://discord.com/api/webhooks/...

docs.title: Raw JSON:
docs.text: dchook info -u https://discord.com/api/webhooks/... --raw

docs.title: Send Command
docs.text:
Send a message to a Discord webhook.

dchook send --url <webhook-url> --message "Hello from CLI"

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Flag Shortcut Description Required --url -u Discord webhook URL ✅ --message -m Message content to send ✅

docs.title: Example
docs.text: dchook send -u https://discord.com/api/webhooks/... -m "Hello from dcHook!"

docs.title: Version Command
docs.text:
Show the current version of dcHook and optionally check the latest release on GitHub.

dchook version

docs.title: Options
docs.text: Flag Shortcut Description Required --offline -o Skip GitHub version check ❌

docs.title: Show local version and check GitHub:
docs.text: dchook version

docs.title: Show local version only (offline mode):
docs.text:
This won't get the latest release version from Github.

dchook version --offline
